page.title: 11EDUCATION IN KEMPSFORD AREA
page.content: In their twelfth year, pupils leave the primary school in{Kempsford village at the end of the Summer Term and start the{secondary}phase of their education in September. Those children who live within {Gloucestershire}are transported daily to{Farmor's {Comprehensive School}in{Fairford,} providing education for 11 to 18 year olds. Those children who live in{ {Marston Meysey}and{Castle Eaton}in{ {Wiltshire}come within the catchment area of {Highworth Comprehensive}, although some, upon request, attend Farmor's. Co-operation between Farmor's and the primary school,such as visits and consultation, assure a smooth transfer. Pupils may leave school at 16 and some opt to attend a Technical College at{Swindon}but they have to provide their own transport.
